problem_text:
15.61. Is it true that lnπ(G) ⩽ n(Gπ)−1 + maxp∈π lp(G) for any π-soluble group G?
Here n(Gπ) is the nilpotent length of a Hall π-subgroup Gπ of the group G and lnπ(G) is the nilpotent π-length of G, that is, the minimum number of π-factors in those normal series of G whose factors are either π′-groups, or nilpotent π-groups. The answer is known to be affirmative in the case when all proper subgroups of Gπ are supersoluble. V. S. Monakhov
